00021 #ifndef VECTOR_H_
00022 #define VECTOR_H_
00023 
00024 #include "Array.h"
00025 #include "Util.h"
00026 #include "Equals.h"
00027 #include "Iterator.h"
00028 
00029 #include <vector>
00030 #include <initializer_list>
00031 
00032 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00033 
00034 SYLPH_PUBLIC
00035 
00039 template<class T>
00040 class Vector : public Object {
00041 public:
00042     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> {
00043     public:
00044         typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> super;
00045 
00046         iterator(bool begin = false, Vector<T>* obj = NULL)
00047         : super(begin), _obj(obj) {
00048             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : _obj->size();
00049         }
00050 
00051         iterator(bool begin = false, const Vector<T>* obj = NULL)
00052         : super(begin), _obj(const_cast<Vector<T>*> (obj)) {
00053             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : _obj->size();
00054         }
00055 
00056         bool equals(const iterator& other) const {
00057             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00058                     _obj == other._obj;
00059         }
00060 
00061         iterator(const iterator& other) {
00062             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00063             _obj = other._obj;
00064         }
00065 
00066         typename super::reference current() const {
00067             return (*_obj)[_currentIndex];
00068         }
00069 
00070         bool hasNext() const {
00071             return _currentIndex < _obj->size();
00072         }
00073 
00074         void next() const {
00075             _currentIndex++;
00076         }
00077 
00078         bool hasPrevious() const {
00079             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00080         }
00081 
00082         void previous() const {
00083             _currentIndex--;
00084         }
00085 
00086         idx_t currentIndex() const {
00087             return _currentIndex;
00088         }
00089 
00090         size_t length() const {
00091             return _obj->size();
00092         }
00093     private:
00094         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00095         Vector<T>* _obj;
00096     };
00097     S_ITERABLE(T)
00098 public:
00099 
00100     explicit Vector(std::size_t initialCount = 16, std::size_t increase = 0) :
00101         elements((std::size_t)initialCount), capacityIncrease(increase),
00102         elementCount(0) {
00103     }
00104 
00105     Vector(const Vector<T> & orig) :
00106             elements((std::size_t)orig.elements->length),
00107             capacityIncrease(orig.capacityIncrease),
00108             elementCount(orig.elementCount) {
00109         arraycopy(orig.elements, 0, elements, 0, orig.elements.length);
00110     }
00111 
00112     Vector(const Array<T> & orig) : elements((size_t)orig.length << 1),
00113             elementCount(orig.length), capacityIncrease(0){
00114         arraycopy(orig, 0, elements, 0, orig.length);
00115     }
00116 
00117     Vector(const std::initializer_list<T> & orig) : elements(orig.size() << 1),
00118             capacityIncrease(0), elementCount(0){
00119         for (T * t = orig.begin(); t < orig.end(); t++) {
00120             this->push(&t);
00121         }
00122     }
00123 
00124     virtual ~Vector() {}
00125 
00126     // vector specific
00127     void push(const T & t) {
00128         add(t);
00129     }
00130 
00131     T pop() {
00132         T toReturn = elements[elementCount - 1];
00133         elementCount--;
00134         return toReturn;
00135     }
00136 
00137     T & get(std::size_t idx) {
00138         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00139         else {
00140             return elements[idx];
00141         }
00142     }
00143 
00144     const T & get(std::size_t idx) const {
00145         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00146         else {
00147             return elements[idx];
00148         }
00149     }
00150 
00151     void set(std::size_t idx, const T & t) {
00152         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00153         else {
00154             elements[idx] = t;
00155         }
00156     }
00157 
00158     void trim() {
00159         Array<T> oldElements = elements;
00160         elements = Array<T>(elementCount);
00161         arraycopy(oldElements, 0, elements, 0, elementCount);
00162     }
00163 
00164     bool add(const T & t) {
00165         ensureCapacity(elementCount + 1);
00166         elements[elementCount] = t;
00167         elementCount++;
00168         return true;
00169     }
00170 
00171     bool addAll(const Vector<T> & c) {
00172     Array<T> ar = c.toArray();
00173     sforeach(T& t, ar) {
00174             this->add(t);
00175         }
00176         return true;
00177     }
00178 
00179     void clear() {
00180         elementCount = 0;
00181         elements.clear();
00182     }
00183 
00184     bool contains(T & t) const {
00185         return indexOf(t) != -1;
00186     }
00187 
00188     bool containsAll(const Vector<T> & c) const {
00189         std::size_t amount = 0;
00190 
00191         sforeach(T & t, c) {
00192             if (this->contains(t)) amount++;
00193         }
00194         return amount == c.size();
00195     }
00196 
00197     bool operator==(const Vector<T> & c) const {
00198         Vector * v = dynamic_cast<Vector> (c);
00199         if (v == NULL) return false;
00200         else if (this->size() != c.size()) return false;
00201         else {
00202             for (std::size_t x = 0; x < c.size(); x++) {
00203                 if (*this[x] != c[x]) return false;
00204             }
00205             return true;
00206         }
00207     }
00208 
00209     bool empty() const {
00210         return size() == 0;
00211     }
00212 
00213     bool remove(const T & t) {
00214         bool b;
00215         (b = indexOf(t) != -1) && removeAt(indexOf(t));
00216         return b;
00217     }
00218 
00219     void removeAt(std::size_t idx) {
00220         if (idx > size()) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00221         elementCount--;
00222         if (idx < elementCount)
00223             arraycopy(elements, idx + 1, elements, idx,
00224                 elementCount - idx);
00225     }
00226 
00227     bool removeAll(const Vector<T> & c) {
00228         std::size_t i;
00229         std::size_t j;
00230         for (i = 0; i < elementCount; i++) {
00231             if (c.contains(elements[i])) break;
00232         }
00233         if (i == elementCount) return false;
00234 
00235         for (j = i++; i < elementCount; i++) {
00236             if (!c.contains(elements[i])) elements[j++] = elements[i];
00237         }
00238         elementCount -= i - j;
00239         return true;
00240     }
00241 
00242     bool retainAll(const Vector<T> & c) {
00243         std::size_t i;
00244         std::size_t j;
00245         for (i = 0; i < elementCount; i++) {
00246             if (!c.contains(elements[i])) break;
00247         }
00248         if (i == elementCount) return false;
00249 
00250         for (j = i++; i < elementCount; i++) {
00251             if (c.contains(elements[i])) elements[j++] = elements[i];
00252         }
00253         elementCount -= i - j;
00254         return true;
00255     }
00256 
00257     std::size_t size() const {
00258         return elementCount;
00259     }
00260 
00261     Array<T> toArray() const {
00262         return elements;
00263     }
00264 
00265     // vector specific non-destructive
00266 
00267     T& front() {
00268         return elements[0];
00269     }
00270     const T & front() const {
00271         return elements[0];
00272     }
00273     
00274     T& back() {
00275         return elements[elementCount - 1];
00276     }
00277 
00278     const T & back() const {
00279         return elements[elementCount - 1];
00280     }
00281 
00282     sidx_t indexOf(T & t, std::idx_t idx = 0) const {
00283         static Equals<T> equf;
00284         for (std::size_t i = idx; i < size(); i++) {
00285             if (equf(*this[i], t)) {
00286                 return i;
00287             }
00288         }
00289         return -1;
00290     }
00291 
00292     inline int lastIndexOf(const T & t) const {
00293         return lastIndexOf(t, elementCount);
00294     }
00295 
00296     sidx_t lastIndexOf(T & t, std::size_t idx) const {
00297         static Equals<T> equf;
00298         if (idx > size()) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00299         for (std::size_t i = idx; i >= 0; i--) {
00300             if (equf((*this)[i], t)) {
00301                 return i;
00302             }
00303         }
00304         return -1;
00305     }
00306 
00307     T & operator[](std::idx_t idx) {
00308         return get(idx);
00309     }
00310 
00311     const T & operator[](std::idx_t idx) const {
00312         return get(idx);
00313     }
00314 
00315     Vector<T> & operator=(const Vector<T> & rhs) const {
00316         delete elements;
00317         elements = Array<T>(rhs.elements.length);
00318         capacityIncrease = rhs.capacityIncrease;
00319         elementCount = rhs.elementCount;
00320         arraycopy(rhs.elements, 0, elements, 0, rhs.elements.length);
00321         return *this;
00322     }
00323 private:
00324     std::size_t elementCount;
00325     std::size_t capacityIncrease;
00326     Array<T> elements;
00327 
00328     void ensureCapacity(std::size_t capacity) {
00329         if (capacity <= elements->length) return;
00330         std::size_t newsize;
00331         if (capacityIncrease == 0) newsize = elements->length * 2;
00332         else newsize = elements->length + capacityIncrease;
00333         Array<T> oldElements = elements;
00334         elements = Array<T>(newsize);
00335         arraycopy(oldElements, 0, elements, 0, oldElements.length);
00336         delete oldElements;
00337     }
00338 };
00339 
00340 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
00341 #endif  /* VECTOR_H_ */
